intro: Hieracium xanthochroum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it typically grows in meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in disturbed soils. Hieracium xanthochroum is an herbaceous perennial that can spread through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
